prompt.body: Which ones of the answers below are period-names?
Which age-name do we use during this chapter?

content.body:
Complete the text (below) with help of the introduction.

Rome started as a small city in the 8th century BC, but became the centre of one of the world's greatest empires. When Rome was just an ordinary city, few people believed such a could happen. Even today, the influence of Rome can be seen in many ways: How we talk about , the style of many buildings and . But the path of Rome was not easy. It took centuries for The Romans to grow their empire to its peak in 117 AD. It developed from a into a and finally an . During this time, many wars were fought. Thousands of miles of roads were built over Europe and many internal disagreements took place. This is the story of Rome.

prompt.body: Check the wordlist. Below there are words, but what do they mean?

content.body: Group of wise, old men that advised the king. Made laws in the Republic.
Way of government where the best (aristos) or the nobles (the landowners) are in charge.
Way of government where the king (or queen) is in charge.
Temporary return of a single-ruler with all powers of the old king.
Way of government where the people (demos) are in charge.
Head of the Senate during the Roman Rpeublic. Also army-leader.

prompt.body: Put the events in the right order to complete the story of Remus and Romulus.

content.body: After I while, they started to fight and Romulus killed his brother.
Remus and Romulus killed their evil uncle and freed the king and their mother.
Shortly after their birth, the twins were left in the woods to die.
A female wolf found them and gave the boys her milk and help them to survive.
The duaghter of the old king, Rea, was forced to became a Vestal Virgin.
A woodsman took the boys with him and raised them.
She was seduced by a great Soldier (the god of War: Mars)
A good king was ruling over the area of Rome, but he was chased away by his evil brother.

prompt.body: The villages on the seven hill tops finally grew together. This also happened because traders started to settle in this area. Now, Rome became ...

content.body: Combining seven villages (plus extra inhabitants, the traders) makes it even larger than that.
This question is not about who is in charge.
This question is not about who is in charge.

Complete the lines below to understand how Rome became a republic.

After Rome became a monarchy and even after him there were other kings. These monarchs were helped by an advisory council called the . This was a meeting of the old and wise members of the landowning families (the ). So, the aristocracy was helping the kings to rule. Finally, there came an Etruscan king with the name Tarquinius, who became a . He had no respect for Roman traditions and was sent away by the nobles. Everyone in Rome was celebrating this event as the end of tyranny. But who would be in charge now? How could the Romans prevent the arrival of a new king who could become a tyrant? Therefore Rome became a . In the senate where the noblemen still had their seats, but from now on they were in charge. However, in case of emergencies like a war, they could decide to appoint a . In that case, the elected person had all powers of the old kings, but only for a short time.

Choose the right words to complete the text to learn about the growth of Rome.

Rome became attractive for people like traders and merchants, but also for those who needed a safe place to live. The arrival of newcomers led to and in particular the of men led to problems. Most of them couldn't become famer, because there wasn't enough fertile farmland. Therefore these men joined the Roman army and took part in the conquest of the Italian peninsula. By the end of the 4th century BC there were two empires left: Rome and . If the Roman expansion would continue, a war against the Carthegians would be inevitable.
